original: Dahlström, Sten Oskar Eugén, målare, skulptör, Norrköping, f. 28/7/99 i Borgviksbruk, Värml. 1. G. 40 m. Margareta Åman. Barn: Leif f. 46. — Stud. v. Art Institute i Chicago 24, v. konstakad. i Sthlm 27. Stud:res. t. Ganada o. Engl, t. Frankr., Hodl, Belg., Norge o. Danm. 33-35. Ester Lindahlstip. 33. Olika anst. 13-35. Bl. skulptiarb.: Gårdfarihandlare, Massage, Aftonbön, Nödår, statyn Mormor (tillh. H. K. H. Prins Eugén) m. fl. Uteslut, måkri sed. 37. Bl arb.: I krigets skugga, Valilonsmeder, Uppbrott, Timmerbröte, Tvätterskor, Axt-löningskväll, Utdrivandet ur paradiset m. fl. Repr. i H. K. H. Prins Eugens konstsaml.. Norrköp., Linköp., Karlstads o. Kristianstads mus. Utställn. i Sthlm 34, 43 o. 45.
translated: Dahlström, Sten Oskar Eugén, painter, sculptor, Norrköping, born on 28/7/99 in Borgviksbruk, Värmland. Married once, in 1940 to Margareta Åman. They had one child, Leif, born in 1946. Studied at the Art Institute in Chicago in 1924 and at the Art Academy in Stockholm in 1927. Had study trips to Canada, England, France, Holland, Belgium, Norway, and Denmark from 1933-1935. Received the Ester Lindahl scholarship in 1933. Had various jobs from 1913-1935. Among his sculptural works are: Gårdfarihandlare, Massage, Aftonbön, Nödår, Mormor statue (belongs to H.K.H. Prince Eugén), among others. Excluded from art exhibitions in 1937 due to his political leanings. His other works include: I krigets skugga, Valilonsmeder, Uppbrott, Timmerbröte, Tvätterskor, Axt-löningskväll, Utdrivandet ur paradiset, among others. Represented in the art collection of H.K.H. Prince Eugen, as well as in museums in Norrköping, Linköping, Karlstad, and Kristianstad. Exhibited in Stockholm in 1934, 1943, and 1945.
